articles.title: Romanian Proposal & Engagement Phrases: How to Pop the Question
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Proposing in your partner's native language is one of the most romantic gestures you can make. Whether you're planning an elaborate cerere √Æn cƒÉsƒÉtorie or a simple, heartfelt moment, knowing how to express your intentions in Romanian will make this milestone unforgettable. This guide covers everything from the perfect proposal phrases to announcing your logodnƒÉ to family and friends.

For more romantic expressions, see our guide on [Romanian pet names and terms of endearment](/blog/en/romanian-pet-names-and-terms-of-endearment).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Vrei sƒÉ te cƒÉsƒÉtore»ôti cu mine?"
  translation="Will you marry me?"
  pronunciation="Vrei sƒÉ te cƒÉsƒÉtore»ôti cu mine?"
  context="The most important question you'll ever ask."
/>

## The Proposal Vocabulary

Master these essential words before your big moment:

<VocabCard
  word="inel"
  translation="ring"
  pronunciation="inel"
  example="The engagement inel sparkles beautifully."
/>

| Romanian | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| cerere √Æn cƒÉsƒÉtorie | proposal | The act of proposing |
| logodnƒÉ | engagement | The period before marriage |
| inel | ring | The engagement ring |
| logodnic | fianc√© | Engaged man |
| logodnicƒÉ | fianc√©e | Engaged woman |
| da | yes | The answer you're hoping for |
| pentru totdeauna | forever | For eternity |
| dragostea vie»õii mele | love of my life | Romantic declaration |

<CultureTip flag="üá∑üá¥" title="Proposal Traditions">
In Romanian-speaking cultures, proposal traditions may include asking the parents for their blessing beforehand. This traditional gesture is still valued by many families and can make a wonderful impression.
</CultureTip>

## Ways to Propose

### The Classic Proposal
**"Vrei sƒÉ te cƒÉsƒÉtore»ôti cu mine?"** - Will you marry me?

This simple, direct question is perfect for any setting. Practice the pronunciation until it feels natural.

### More Romantic Variations
- **"You are the dragostea vie»õii mele. Vrei sƒÉ te cƒÉsƒÉtore»ôti cu mine?"** - Adding a declaration of love
- **"I want to spend pentru totdeauna with you."** - Building to the question
- **"Will you make me the happiest person in the world?"** - An alternative approach

<VocabCard
  word="logodit/logoditƒÉ"
  translation="engaged"
  pronunciation="logodit/logoditƒÉ"
  example="We are logodit/logoditƒÉ!"
/>

## Announcing Your Engagement

Once your partner says "da!", you'll want to share the news:

### To Family
- **"We're logodit/logoditƒÉ!"** - The joyful announcement
- **"logodnic/logodnicƒÉ said da!"** - Sharing the excitement
- **"We have wonderful news!"** - Building anticipation

### To Friends
- **"Guess what happened?"** - Creating suspense
- **"Look at my inel!"** - Showing off the ring
- **"We're getting married!"** - Direct and joyful

### On Social Media
- **"She/He said da!"** - Classic announcement
- **"pentru totdeauna starts now!"** - Romantic caption
- **"logodit/logoditƒÉ to my dragostea vie»õii mele"** - Heartfelt declaration

<CultureTip flag="üá∑üá¥" title="Engagement Celebrations">
In many Romanian-speaking families, an logodnƒÉ party is held to celebrate the couple. This gathering allows both families to meet and celebrate the upcoming union together.
</CultureTip>

## Ring Vocabulary

The inel is central to the cerere √Æn cƒÉsƒÉtorie:

| Romanian | English | Description |
|---|---|---|
| inel | ring | The piece of jewelry |
| Engagement inel | engagement ring | The symbol of commitment |
| Diamond | diamond | Popular gemstone |
| Gold | gold | Common metal |
| Fit | fit | How the ring sits |

## Preparing Your Proposal

### Practice Tips
1. **Record yourself** saying the proposal
2. **Practice with your partner's name**
3. **Time your delivery** for natural flow
4. **Prepare for emotion** - it's okay to be nervous

### Setting the Scene
Consider these romantic elements:
- A meaningful location
- The right moment
- Having someone to photograph (secretly!)
- The inel ready and accessible

## After They Say Yes

The moments after the cerere √Æn cƒÉsƒÉtorie are magical:

| Moment | What to Say | Translation |
|---|---|---|
| Right after | I love you so much! | Declaration of love |
| First call | We're logodit/logoditƒÉ! | Announcement |
| First photo | My logodnic/logodnicƒÉ! | New title |

For more ways to express your love, explore our [how to say I love you in Romanian](/blog/en/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-romanian) guide.

## Quick Reference

| Purpose | Phrase |
|---|---|
| Propose | Vrei sƒÉ te cƒÉsƒÉtore»ôti cu mine? |
| React to yes | You said da! |
| Announce | We're logodit/logoditƒÉ! |
| Introduce | My logodnic/logodnicƒÉ |

Your cerere √Æn cƒÉsƒÉtorie in Romanian will be a story you'll tell pentru totdeauna. Take your time, speak from the heart, and let your love shine through every word.

<CTA />

articles.title: Norske 'Jeg Savner Dig' S√¶tninger for Danskere
articles.content:
Norsk og dansk er s√• t√¶t besl√¶gtede i skrift, at mange s√¶tninger n√¶sten er identiske. Men udtalen er vidt forskellig, og at kunne udtrykke savn med korrekt norsk udtale vil imponere din partner.

## Savn p√• Norsk

Norsk bruger "savne" ligesom dansk. Skriften er n√¶sten ens, men den syngende norske udtale g√∏r det til en anden oplevelse.

## Grundl√¶ggende Udtryk

### "Jeg savner deg"
**Udtale:** jaj SAV-ner daj

**Betydning:** Jeg savner dig

Bem√¶rk "deg" i stedet for dansk "dig" og den norske udtale af "jeg".

### "Jeg savner deg s√• mye"
**Udtale:** jaj SAV-ner daj so MY-e

**Betydning:** Jeg savner dig s√• meget

Tilf√∏jer intensitet.

### "Jeg tenker p√• deg hele tiden"
**Udtale:** jaj TEN-ker po daj HE-le TI-den

**Betydning:** Jeg t√¶nker p√• dig hele tiden

Viser at personen konstant er i dine tanker.

## Dybere Udtryk

### "Hvert √∏yeblikk uten deg f√∏les som en evighet"
**Udtale:** vert √òJ-e-blik U-ten daj F√ò-les som en E-vi-het

**Betydning:** Hvert √∏jeblik uden dig f√∏les som en evighed

Poetisk og romantisk.

### "Du er det f√∏rste jeg tenker p√• n√•r jeg v√•kner"
**Udtale:** du er de F√òR-ste jaj TEN-ker po nor jaj VOK-ner

**Betydning:** Du er det f√∏rste, jeg t√¶nker p√•, n√•r jeg v√•gner

Romantisk morgenbekendelse.

### "Jeg skulle √∏nske du var her"
**Udtale:** jaj SKU-le √òN-ske du var her

**Betydning:** Jeg ville √∏nske, du var her

Udtrykker dyb l√¶ngsel.

## Hverdagens Savn

### "Jeg savner smilet ditt"
**Udtale:** jaj SAV-ner SMI-le dit

**Betydning:** Jeg savner dit smil

Specifikt og personligt.

### "Jeg savner √• sovne ved siden av deg"
**Udtale:** jaj SAV-ner o SOV-ne ve SI-den av daj

**Betydning:** Jeg savner at falde i s√∏vn ved siden af dig

Intimt og k√¶rligt.

### "Jeg savner samtalene v√•re"
**Udtale:** jaj SAV-ner sam-TA-le-ne VO-re

**Betydning:** Jeg savner vores samtaler

Viser at du savner den dybe forbindelse.

## Intense Udtryk

### "Jeg savner deg mer enn ord kan beskrive"
**Udtale:** jaj SAV-ner daj mer en ord kan be-SKRI-ve

**Betydning:** Jeg savner dig mere end ord kan beskrive

N√•r savnet er overv√¶ldende.

### "√Ö v√¶re langt fra deg er det vanskeligste"
**Udtale:** o V√Ü-re langt fra daj er de VAN-ske-li-ste

**Betydning:** At v√¶re langt fra dig er det sv√¶reste

Udtrykker smerten.

### "Jeg teller dagene til jeg ser deg igjen"
**Udtale:** jaj TE-ler DA-ge-ne til jaj ser daj i-JEN

**Betydning:** Jeg t√¶ller dagene til jeg ser dig igen

H√•befuldt fokus.

## Tr√∏stende S√¶tninger

### "Avstand betyr ingenting n√•r noen betyr alt"
**Udtale:** AV-stand be-TYR IN-gen-ting nor NO-en be-TYR alt

**Betydning:** Afstand betyder intet, n√•r nogen betyder alt

Smuk p√•mindelse.

### "Uansett hvor du er, er du alltid i hjertet mitt"
**Udtale:** u-AN-set vor du er, er du AL-tid i JER-te mit

**Betydning:** Uanset hvor du er, er du altid i mit hjerte

Tr√∏stende og k√¶rlig.

## Norsk vs. Dansk

Nogle forskelle:

| Dansk | Norsk |
|-------|-------|
| dig | deg |
| meget | mye |
| hvorn√•r | n√•r |
| sv√¶rt | vanskelig |
| jeg (ja) | jeg (jaj) |

## Kulturelle Tips

**Friluftsliv:** Nordm√¶nd elsker naturen. Del billeder af udenfor!

**Kos:** Det norske ord for hygge. Skab "koselige" √∏jeblikke sammen p√• afstand.

**Direkthed:** Som danskere er nordm√¶nd relativt direkte.

**Dialekter:** Norsk har mange dialekter ‚Äì din partner taler m√•ske anderledes end standard.

## Afsluttende Ord

Som dansker har du en naturlig fordel med norsk. Skriften er n√¶sten ens, s√• fokuser p√• udtalen. Din norske partner vil elske at h√∏re dig pr√∏ve.

Husk: Ekte kj√¶rlighet kjenner ingen avstand. (Husk: √Ügte k√¶rlighed kender ingen afstand.)

articles.title: M√∏d Svigerfor√¶ldrene p√• Russisk: Essentielle Udtryk
articles.content:
# M√∏d Svigerfor√¶ldrene p√• Russisk: Essentielle Udtryk

At m√∏de russiske svigerfor√¶ldre er en oplevelse fyldt med traditioner, varme og rigelig mad. Russere har en st√¶rk familiekultur, og at blive accepteret i familien er en stor √¶re. Med de rigtige udtryk kan du vise respekt og vinde deres hjerter.

## Kulturelle Tips inden M√∏det

Russere bruger den formelle "–í—ã" (De) til √¶ldre og personer, de lige har m√∏dt. Medbring en gave ‚Äì blomster (ulige antal) til v√¶rtinden og chokolade eller vin til familien. V√¶r forberedt p√• rigelig mad og drikke ‚Äì at afsl√• betragtes som uh√∏fligt.

## De Vigtigste Udtryk

### 1. –û—á–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç—å—Å—è
**Udtale:** Ààot…ï…™n ≤ pr ≤…™Ààjatn…ô p…ôzn…êÀàkom ≤…™ts…ô (O-chen pree-YAT-na paz-na-KO-mee-tsa)

**Betydning:** Det gl√¶der mig meget at m√∏de jer.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** Dette er den klassiske formelle hilsen ved f√∏rste m√∏de.

### 2. –°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–µ –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ
**Udtale:** sp…êÀàs ≤ib…ô b…êl ≤Àà Çoj…ô za pr ≤…™…°l…êÀà Ç…õn ≤…™j…ô (spa-SEE-ba bal-SHO-ye za pree-gla-SHEN-ee-ye)

**Betydning:** Mange tak for invitationen.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** Vis taknemmelighed fra starten ‚Äì det v√¶rds√¶ttes h√∏jt.

### 3. –£ –≤–∞—Å –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–π –¥–æ–º
**Udtale:** u vas Ààot…ï…™n ≤ kr…êÀàs ≤iv…®j dom (oo vas O-chen kra-SEE-vy dom)

**Betydning:** I har et meget smukt hjem.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** Komplimenter hjemmet ‚Äì russere er stolte af deres hjem.

### 4. –Ø –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª/—Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª–∞ –æ –≤–∞—Å
**Udtale:** ja Ààmno…°…ô Ààsl…® Ç…ôl/Ààsl…® Ç…ôl…ô …ê vas (ya MNO-ga SLY-shal/SLY-sha-la a vas)

**Betydning:** Jeg har h√∏rt meget om jer.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** M√¶nd siger "—Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª", kvinder siger "—Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª–∞".

### 5. –û—á–µ–Ω—å –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω–æ! –ú–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç?
**Udtale:** Ààot…ï…™n ≤ Ààfkusn…ô Ààmo ên…ô p…ôpr…êÀàs ≤it ≤ r ≤…™Ààts…õpt (O-chen FKOOS-na MOZH-na pa-pra-SEET re-TSEPT)

**Betydning:** Meget l√¶kkert! M√• jeg bede om opskriften?

**Kulturelt r√•d:** Mad er central i russisk g√¶stfrihed. At sp√∏rge om opskriften er en stor kompliment.

### 6. –Ø –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ä–∞–¥/—Ä–∞–¥–∞ –±—ã—Ç—å –∑–¥–µ—Å—å
**Udtale:** ja Ààot…ï…™n ≤ rat/Ààrad…ô b…®t ≤ zd ≤es ≤ (ya O-chen rat/RA-da byt zdes)

**Betydning:** Jeg er meget glad for at v√¶re her.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** M√¶nd siger "—Ä–∞–¥", kvinder siger "—Ä–∞–¥–∞".

### 7. –ú–æ–≥—É —è –ø–æ–º–æ—á—å —É–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å —Å–æ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∞?
**Udtale:** m…êÀà…°u ja p…êÀàmot…ï uÀàbrat ≤ s…ô st…êÀàla (ma-GOO ya pa-MOCH oo-BRAT sa sta-LA)

**Betydning:** M√• jeg hj√¶lpe med at rydde bordet?

**Kulturelt r√•d:** At tilbyde hj√¶lp viser gode manerer.

### 8. –í–∞—à —Å—ã–Ω/–í–∞—à–∞ –¥–æ—á—å –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –≤–∞–∂–µ–Ω/–≤–∞–∂–Ω–∞ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è
**Udtale:** va Ç s…®n/Ààva Ç…ô dot…ï Ààot…ï…™n ≤ Ààva ê…ôn/v…ê êÀàna dl ≤…ô m ≤…™Ààn ≤a (vash syn/VA-sha doch O-chen VA-zhen/vazh-NA dlya me-NYA)

**Betydning:** Jeres s√∏n/datter er meget vigtig for mig.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** Russiske for√¶ldre s√¶tter pris p√• oprigtighed om intentioner.

### 9. –ù–∞–¥–µ—é—Å—å, –º—ã —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ —Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞ —É–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è
**Udtale:** n…êÀàd ≤ejus ≤ m…® Ààskor…ô Ààsnov…ô uÀàv ≤id ≤…™ms ≤…ô (na-DAY-yus my SKO-ra SNO-va oo-VEE-deem-sya)

**Betydning:** Jeg h√•ber, vi ses igen snart.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** Vis √∏nske om at v√¶re en del af familien.

### 10. –°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –∑–∞ —á—É–¥–µ—Å–Ω—ã–π –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä
**Udtale:** sp…êÀàs ≤ib…ô za t…ï äÀàd ≤esn…®j Ààv ≤et…ï…™r (spa-SEE-ba za choo-DES-ny VE-cher)

**Betydning:** Tak for en vidunderlig aften.

**Kulturelt r√•d:** Afslut altid med varme taknemmelighed.

### 11. –ó–∞ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—å–µ!
**Udtale:** z…ô zd…êÀàrov ≤j…ô (za zda-RO-vye)

**Betydning:** Sk√•l! (Bogstaveligt: Til helbredet!)

**Kulturelt r√•d:** En klassisk russisk sk√•l. V√¶r forberedt p√• flere!

## Samtaleeksempel

**Svigermor:** –î–æ–±—Ä–æ –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å! –ü—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ!
**Dig:** –°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–µ –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –£ –≤–∞—Å –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–π –¥–æ–º!
**Svigerfar:** –ü—Ä–∏—Å–∞–∂–∏–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—å, –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞.
**Dig:** –°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ. –Ø –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª –æ –≤–∞—Å.

## Afsluttende R√•d

Russere v√¶rds√¶tter varme, √¶rlighed og respekt for traditioner. V√¶r forberedt p√• rigelig mad, mange toasts og lange samtaler. Vis √¶gte interesse i familien, v√¶r respektfuld over for de √¶ldre, og husk ‚Äì russisk g√¶stfrihed er legendarisk!

articles.title: Portuguese Making Up & Reconciliation Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Making up after an argument‚Äî"fazer as pazes"‚Äîis an important moment in any relationship. When your partner speaks Portuguese, knowing how to reconcile in their language deepens your connection. Here are essential Portuguese phrases for healing and restoring harmony.

## Apologizing Sincerely

### Desculpa / Sinto muito
**Pronunciation:** desh-KOOL-pah / SEEN-too MWEEN-too

**Meaning:** "Sorry" / "I'm very sorry"

**When to use it:** Basic apologies. "Sinto muito" is more emotionally heavy.

### Perdoa-me
**Pronunciation:** pehr-DOH-ah-meh

**Meaning:** "Forgive me"

**When to use it:** A direct, vulnerable request for forgiveness.

### Eu estava errado/a
**Pronunciation:** EH-oo esh-TAH-vah eh-RAH-doo/dah

**Meaning:** "I was wrong"

**When to use it:** When taking clear responsibility. Use "errado" if male, "errada" if female.

### N√£o devia ter dito aquilo
**Pronunciation:** now deh-VEE-ah tehr DEE-too ah-KEE-loo

**Meaning:** "I shouldn't have said that"

**When to use it:** When regretting specific words spoken.

## Expressing Your Feelings

### Detesto quando discutimos
**Pronunciation:** deh-TESH-too KWAHN-doo deesh-koo-TEE-moosh

**Meaning:** "I hate when we argue"

**When to use it:** To express how much conflict affects you.

### Sinto a tua falta quando estamos assim
**Pronunciation:** SEEN-too ah TOO-ah FAHL-tah KWAHN-doo esh-TAH-moosh ah-SEEM

**Meaning:** "I miss you when we're like this"

**When to use it:** To express emotional distance even when together.

### D√≥i-me quando estamos zangados
**Pronunciation:** DOY-meh KWAHN-doo esh-TAH-moosh zahn-GAH-doosh

**Meaning:** "It hurts me when we're angry"

**When to use it:** To share the pain of being at odds.

## Reaching Out

### Podemos conversar?
**Pronunciation:** poh-DEH-moosh kohn-vehr-SAHR

**Meaning:** "Can we talk?"

**When to use it:** To initiate reconciliation.

### Quero resolver as coisas
**Pronunciation:** KEH-roo reh-zohl-VEHR ahsh KOY-zahsh

**Meaning:** "I want to resolve things"

**When to use it:** To show commitment to making things right.

### Podemos come√ßar de novo?
**Pronunciation:** poh-DEH-moosh koh-meh-SAHR deh NOH-voo

**Meaning:** "Can we start over?"

**When to use it:** When you want to reset and move forward.

## Expressing Love and Commitment

### Amo-te, isso n√£o muda
**Pronunciation:** AH-moo-teh, EE-soo now MOO-dah

**Meaning:** "I love you, that doesn't change"

**When to use it:** To reassure during reconciliation. (Brazilian: "Te amo")

### √âs mais importante do que esta discuss√£o
**Pronunciation:** ehsh mahysh eem-pohr-TAHN-teh doo keh EHS-tah deesh-koo-SOWN

**Meaning:** "You're more important than this argument"

**When to use it:** To prioritize the relationship.

### N√£o te quero perder
**Pronunciation:** now teh KEH-roo pehr-DEHR

**Meaning:** "I don't want to lose you"

**When to use it:** To express how much the relationship matters.

### Somos uma equipa
**Pronunciation:** SOH-moosh OO-mah eh-KEE-pah

**Meaning:** "We're a team"

**When to use it:** To remind each other you're partners.

## Moving Forward

### Como podemos evitar isto no futuro?
**Pronunciation:** KOH-moo poh-DEH-moosh eh-vee-TAHR EESH-too noo foo-TOO-roo

**Meaning:** "How can we avoid this in the future?"

**When to use it:** To focus on growth and prevention.

### Prometo tentar fazer melhor
**Pronunciation:** proh-MEH-too ten-TAHR fah-ZEHR meh-LYOHR

**Meaning:** "I promise to try to do better"

**When to use it:** To commit to improvement.

## Cultural Notes

Portuguese speakers (both European and Brazilian) often value warmth and emotional connection in reconciliation. Physical affection, gentle touches, and proximity help restore harmony.

Brazilian Portuguese tends to be more informal and emotionally expressive, while European Portuguese may be slightly more reserved‚Äîbut both cultures value genuine emotional connection.

Sharing time together‚Äîa meal, a walk, or simply being close‚Äîoften matters as much as words. "Saudade" (missing someone/longing) is a uniquely Portuguese concept that captures the pain of emotional distance.

## Restoring Harmony

Making up in Portuguese is about returning to warmth and closeness. Whether you use "Te amo" (Brazilian) or "Amo-te" (European), expressing love after conflict reminds your partner that your bond transcends any disagreement. The goal is restoring the caring connection that defines your relationship.

articles.title: 50 Portuguese Compliments for Your Partner
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Nothing makes your partner feel more loved than a heartfelt compliment in their native language. Portuguese has a rich vocabulary for expressing admiration, from simple everyday compliments to deeply romantic declarations that will make your partner melt. Let's explore the art of Portuguese flattery.

## The Basics: Beautiful and Handsome

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Voc√™ √© lindo(a)"
  translation="You are handsome/beautiful"
  pronunciation="voh-SEH eh LEEN-doo / LEEN-dah"
  context="The most versatile compliment for your partner's appearance"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Lindo / Linda"
  translation="Handsome / Beautiful"
  pronunciation="LEEN-doo / LEEN-dah"
  example="Amor, voc√™ est√° linda hoje! (Love, you look beautiful today!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bonito / Bonita"
  translation="Good-looking / Pretty"
  pronunciation="boh-NEE-too / boh-NEE-tah"

<CultureTip
  title="Gender Agreement in Compliments"
  flag="üáµüáπ"
>
  Remember that Portuguese adjectives change based on the gender of the person you're complimenting. Use "lindo," "bonito," "gato" for men and "linda," "bonita," "gata" for women. This attention to detail shows your partner you're truly learning their language!
</CultureTip>

## How to Accept Compliments in Portuguese

When your partner compliments you back, here's how to respond gracefully:

<VocabCard
  word="Obrigado(a), amor"
  translation="Thank you, love"

<VocabCard
  word="Voc√™ tamb√©m"

/>

<VocabCard
  word="Que isso! Voc√™ que √©"
  translation="Oh stop! You're the one"
  pronunciation="kee EE-soo! voh-SEH kee eh"
  example="A humble Brazilian response to deflect the compliment back"
/>

<CultureTip
  title="The Art of Receiving Compliments"
  flag="üáµüáπ"
>
  In Portuguese-speaking cultures, it's common to deflect compliments modestly rather than simply saying "thank you." Phrases like "Que isso!" (Oh, stop!) or "Imagina!" (Imagine that!) are typical humble responses, though between couples, accepting the compliment warmly is always appreciated.
</CultureTip>

## Practice Makes Perfect

Remember: the best compliment is one that comes from the heart. Even if your pronunciation isn't perfect, your partner will feel the love behind your words.
